title.narrative: CARSI-ESF-Regional DC Crime Prevention in Central America

description.narrative: LAC/RP will continue activities through Municipal Partnerships for Violence Prevention in the development of a regional network of municipalities working on crime prevention in Central America and the Dominican Republic. This program will also carry out exchanges between municipal actors from Central America, the U.S., and potentially others from across and beyond the LAC region to share and implement successful municipally-based crime prevention activities. LAC/RP funds will be used to increase municipal awareness of trafficking in persons and help municipal leaders integrate trafficking in persons prevention into their crime and violence prevention activities.*****(State Western Hemisphere Regional): Municipal Partnerships for Violence Prevention in Central America. Funds will be used to continue activities with ICMA in the development of a regional network of municipalities in Central America working on crime prevention. This program will also carry on exchanges between municipal actors from Central America, the U.S., and potentially others from across and beyond the LAC region to share and implement successful municipally-based crime prevention activities. Funds will allow the program to increase sustainability of the regional network beyond the life of the program and to build trilateral partnerships between Central American and other Latin American countries on municipal-level crime and violence prevention.
